pr_title: Adds RemoteGetter and RemoteSetter used for kind-based injection in B3Propagation

timeline.message:
Returns B3Propagation.Factory singleton when building default

Similar to how we unwrap when a builder results in no change, building
B3Propagation.Factory can result in no difference than the singleton.

By re-using this, configuration frameworks can tell if there was no
change, at least tests are easier in sleuth now.

timeline.bodyText: in a future change we can actually return a constant injector, as the formats won't change per call to inject. The advantage would be similar to other places where we have constant vs composite... even though the iteration across an array of size two is fast, it shouldn't be quicker than something with no array. By default, there's only one inject format per kind.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText:
oh... I have an idea that's much easier! Add a subtype in request!
Request.Setter extends Propagation.Setter
exposes spanKind()
With this, we can hardwire B3 without needing reflection at runtime except the slow path for things that haven't extended Request.Setter yet.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText:
I'm tempted to do generic foo in <R> TraceContext.Injector<R> injector(Setter<R, K> setter); to find out the bound of R.. (reflection look up the TypeVariable of the setter) if we could, and found it was a request, then we wouldn't have to do this runtime check!
not tempted now. just a nag for future.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: This is an internal type exctracted from B3. I don't plan to do a huge amount of polishing on this in this PR as I'm at a severe time deficit. I will puts with it post merge though and any significant changes needed pre-merge
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: I lied.. polish is here now
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: Don't think Arrays.asList does so probably want to check all the elements aren't null too
timeline.author: anuraaga

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/brave/src/main/java/brave/internal/propagation/InjectorFactory.java b/brave/src/main/java/brave/internal/propagation/InjectorFactory.java index 1f3bf3cac..56d1aab4e 100644 --- a/brave/src/main/java/brave/internal/propagation/InjectorFactory.java +++ b/brave/src/main/java/brave/internal/propagation/InjectorFactory.java @@ -32,7 +32,7 @@ import java.util.Set; * *

When {@link RemoteSetter} is implemented, {@link #newInjector(Setter)} will create an * injector that is pre-configured for {@link RemoteSetter#spanKind()}. Otherwise, it will create an - * injector that defers until {@link Injector#inject(TraceContext, Object)} is called. + * injector that defers until {@link RemoteInjector#inject(TraceContext, Object)} is called. * *

A deferred injector checks if the {@code request} parameter is an instance of {@link * Request}, it considers {@link Request#spanKind()}. If so, it uses this for injection formats
